title: Drawing, Three Designs for Candlesticks, 1802
medium: pen and ink, brush and sepia wash, gray, yellow watercolor, graphite on light blue paper
markings: Watermark: escutcheon with horn above crown
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and ink, verso: Latitudine dell' gradino ove devone posaré. Li tre candellieri maggiori; in pen and ink, verso, vertically: altezza delli sei candellieri senza il suo bocaglio il quale vede / i quattro contro lomi dell' tutto simmili solo una. Si i pio bassi; in pen and ink, verso, below, on another line: altezza dell Cristo con sua croce / e suo basamento dall' quale / non si puote sortire il piantato / dell' Cristo deve posare sopra di / un cuppolina di un temppio; in pen and ink, verso, accompanying a plan of a base: pianta di quelle di / marmo che gia esistano
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Three designs for candlesticks labeled A, B,C from left to right. The inscription, "Qui ci va, etc." as written in 1938-88-624, appears in the pedestals of all three candlesticks. At left, candlestick A is supported by crouching lions carrying calyces. The pedestal is a richer variation of the one that appears in E in 1938-88-624. The shaft is  a foliated baluster above a calyx. At center, B is supported by tortoises upon knobs. The shaft has, below, a bowl in the two calyces; above, a fluted column. At left, C is also supported by tortoises. The shaft consists of a calyx in opposite direction, a capital, and of a column with a base, calyx, spiral flutes and scallops. Verso: plan of a base and inscriptions.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Three Designs for Candlesticks, 1802; Designed by Luigi Righetti (Italian, 1780 - 1819); Italy; pen and ink, brush and sepia wash, gray, yellow watercolor, graphite on light blue paper; 33.5 × 39.6 cm (13 3/16 × 15 9/16 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund; 1938-88-626
